#Summary1=(human1) In this podcast, the editors of the Global Voices podcast discuss with Rezwan and Pantha about Mangal Shobhajatra, a festive annual procession with singing, dancing, and colorful displays for the Bengali New Year that takes place in Dhaka, Bangladesh and serves as a symbol of unity and diversity in Bangladesh.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) The Mangal Shobhajatra, an annual New Year's celebration in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka featuring masks, music and dancing, is more than just a festive parade but serves as a creative stand for unity and diversity against forces of intolerance and division.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) On the Global Voices podcast, hosts discuss Mangal Shobhajatra, an annual Bengali New Year procession in Dhaka celebrated with masks, songs, and festivities, recognized by UNESCO as a cultural heritage symbol, promoting unity and countering global intolerance in places like Myanmar and South Africa.

#Summary4=(Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct; postedited) The Mangal Shobhajatra is an annual procession in Dhaka, Bangladesh, marking the start of the Bengali New Year, which symbolizes unity and resistance to intolerance, and is a vibrant celebration of art, music, and cultural heritage.

#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Mangal Shobhajatra is a vibrant, inclusive Bengali New Year procession in Dhaka, Bangladesh, featuring colorful masks, music, dance, and Tagore songs, symbolizing unity and resistance against intolerance.
#Text=What you 're hearing is Mangal Shobhajatra , an annual procession of thousands of people that takes over the streets of Bangladesh 's capital city , Dhaka .
#Text=It marks the start of the Bengali New Year , and as you might expect of a New Year 's celebration , it 's a very festive affair .
#Text=Not long ago , UNSECO , which is the educational , scientific and cultural agency of the United Nations , named this parade intangible cultural heritage .
#Text=But what might look like just a street party is actually a creative stand for unity and against the forces of intolerance who seek to divide and oppress Bangladeshis .
#Text=Welcome to Into the Deep , The Global Voices podcast , where we dig deep into one topic that is n't getting the media coverage it deserves .
#Text=I 'm Lauren , news editor at Global Voices .
#Text=I live in Bilbao , Spain .
#Text=And I 'm Sahar , managing editor at Global Voices .
#Text=I 'm currently in Lahore , Pakistan , and today we are digging deep into Bangladesh 's Mangal Shobhajatra .

#Text=The tide of xenophobia has seemingly swept Europe and the United States in recent years , culminating in 2016 with the UK 's vote to leave the European Union and the election of Donald Trump in the US .
#Text=But intolerance is not a phenomenon that 's exclusive to the Western world by any means .
#Text=From Myanmar to South Africa to Indonesia , there are those who view diversity as a source of fear rather than strength .
#Text=What about you ?
#Text=Do you disagree with this trend ?
#Text=And are you thinking about what to do to combat these forces that want to sow the seeds of division ?
#Text=Perhaps then Bangladesh and its unique New Year 's procession can offer some inspiration .
#Text=Mangal sh- -- .
#Text=How does it go ?
#Text=Mangal Shobhajatra .
#Text=It 's -- in Bangla we always pronounce o , so it 's a a --
#Text=Although it is written in English as M A N , but it sounds more like Mongol .
#Text=O .
#Text=Okay .
#Text=And the second part ?
#Text=Say it again very slowly .
#Text=Shobhajatra .
#Text=Shobha- .
#Text=Shobha- .
#Text=Shobhajatra .
#Text=Okay , perfect .
#Text=We do n't want to mess it up .
#Text=Mangal Shobhajatra .
#Text=Yeah , Mangal Shobhajatra .
#Text=That 's Rezwan .
#Text=This is Rezwan from Bangladesh .
#Text=He 's a blogger and the South Asia editor for Global Voices .
#Text=Mangal Shobhajatra is like a carnival or a victory rally .
#Text=It 's it ’s very loud , with people shouting , shouting different slogans and , uh , they 're singing , they 're dancing and people participate with uh joy .
#Text=It 's a vibrant , colorful , creative , open for all secular identity .
#Text=Uh , a lot of fun is here .
#Text=And that 's Pantha .
#Text=This is also from Dhaka , Bangladesh .
#Text=He 's a copywriter and a member of the Global Voices community , who 's been writing for us now for several years .
#Text=We spoke to both Pantha and Rezwan to learn more about Mangal Shobhajatra .
#Text=Yeah , it it all starts with making of masks .

#Text=Actually , the students of uh the Charukola Institute , which is the , uh , Faculty of Fine Arts of Dhaka University and uh they prepare all these , uh , all kinds of interesting masks , and they are very colorful , and they bear animals and demons and mythical mythical faces and all .
#Text=And those are pretty interesting .

#Text=And people carry those masks , uh , in , in batons , or they put it on their face and they , they dance and , uh , on the way there are like many street shops , uh , for food and , and and balloons , children are running around .
#Text=The procession takes place every year on the morning of the first day of the Bengali calendar , which is April 14th or 15th .
#Text=Students and teachers of Dhaka University 's Faculty of Fine Arts organize it and anyone is free to join in .
#Text=Have either of you attended ?
#Text=Yeah , uh , many times .
#Text=Um , it 's one of the go go to things that -- uh , during the New Year celebration .
#Text=So we have a kind of ritual .
#Text=So , uh , on the first day of the new year , we go in the morning to listen to , uh , Rabindra Sangeet .
#Text=That is uh Tagore songs .
#Text=Rabindra Sangeet or Tagore songs or popular songs that were written in the late 19th and early 20th centuries by a man named Rabindranath Tagore .
#Text=They 're often based on Hindustani classical music and folk music of Bengal .
#Text=An interesting fact , Rabindranath Tagore was the first non-European to win the Nobel Prize in Literature .
